This app is designed to be used as a steering wheel in some popular truck simulators like Euro Truck Simulator 2 and American Truck Simulator.

Developer: Alex Churkin

Contact:
churkinapps@gmail.com

The application uses icons from here:
http://icons8.com
First, you need to download & install Truck Remote Server and run it on your computer. You can do it by this link: https://github.com/alexChurkin/TruckRemoteServer .
As you can see, you can specify connection port and steering sensitivity as you want. Then you need to start the game and select Keyboard + vJoy in Controls.
It\'s important to use only \"Simple Automatic\" transmission and set \"Steering sensitivity\" and \"Steering non-linearity\" as follows:
When using force feedback, it is also recommended to disable all types of feedback in the game, except for the Collisions (50%), Bumps (~15%) and Terrain (~10%).
Make sure all keys in the control settings are set as standard. Enter the game and proceed to the next step.

Ensure that your phone/tablet is connected to the same network as the computer. Connect your Truck Remote Control app to the Server app on your computer. This can be done automatically or manually. You can configure a standard ip/server in the settings.
You can enable cruise control by swiping gas up and disable it by swipe or touching break.
